Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, interior spotted with an off-white granular deposit, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip and with faint traces of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents as year 9 wine from the western river.
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 50
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393182) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393182)
